nodes.documentation:
* 
The game is very simple:
- You, the staker, will have a goal you intend to achieve. 
- You will use the app to 1) input your goal, 2) declare a minimum amount to bet on yourself, and 3) set a duration of how long you will give yourself to achieve this goal. 
- You and your sponsor will bet. After duration passes, the judge will arbitrate the outcome (success for failure)
- If you achieved your goal during this period of time, you will get your staked Eth back in full and also win the sponsor's bet. 
- But if you fail, you will lose your staked bet.
nodes.name: Goalify

nodes.documentation: @notice If total betting amount exceeds the max pot (10x minimum betSize), then the excess from overbettting will be refunded back to msg.sender.
nodes.name: refundExcess

arguments.value: cannot bet more than 10x betSize

nodes.documentation: @notice If max pot is reached, no more bet is allowed
nodes.name: capBet

params.decision: This is a binary decision the judge must make. "1" is success and "2" is failure

approve(uint8,uint80).return: The decision has been made if true.

params._goalId: This is the lable of the goal in the mapping "goals". This should always be "0", as we will only have 1 goal set.

params._duration: The lengthn of time allowed for the goal to complete. For simplicity and demonstration purposes, duration should be in minutes.
params._statement: The name and description of the goal

viewPot(uint8).return: The balance of the pot. This is a view function.

approve(uint8,uint80).notice: Function can only be called if goal's entire duration has passed. Only judge can approve / call this function. Decsion is binary (success or fail). State must be at Betting for this function to be called.

bet(uint8).notice: There 120 second windown to bet. Betters must be staker or sponsor. Each bet must be > than betSize. Contract State can be in both CREATED and BETTING.If total betting amount exceeds the max pot (10x minimum betSize), then excess will be refunded and no more bet is allowed (reflected through two modifers).

createGoal(string,uint256,uint256).notice: This is where the staker creates the goal

distribute(uint8).notice: This is the seperate withdraw function ("Pull over Push" Design Pattern). All internal accounting work is finalized before calling the external "transfer" function.

setJudge().notice: There is a 30 seconds window for judge to set himself as judge

setSponsor().notice: There is a 30 seconds window for sponsor to set himself as sponsor

toggleCircuitBreaker().notice: This is a function that if called will toggle the circuit breaker and halt entire contract from progressing. Only admin can call this function.

userdoc.notice: *  The game is very simple: - You, the staker, will have a goal you intend to achieve.  - You will use the app to 1) input your goal, 2) declare a minimum amount to bet on yourself, and 3) set a duration of how long you will give yourself to achieve this goal.  - You and your sponsor will bet. After duration passes, the judge will arbitrate the outcome (success for failure) - If you achieved your goal during this period of time, you will get your staked Eth back in full and also win the sponsor's bet.  - But if you fail, you will lose your staked bet.
